definition: to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
number/figure/several/CL:個|个[ge4]
frequently/repeatedly

sentences.english: He would order 300 musicians at a time to play the Yu for him.
sentences.chinese: 有一个南郭先生，本来不会吹竽，也混在中间凑数。

sentences.english: If any guest failed at the eleventh hour, Todd was asked to dine.
sentences.chinese: 要是有什么客人到时不能来，托德就给请来凑数。

sentences.english: We don't want to bring anyone in just for the sake of bringing.
sentences.chinese: 我们不会为了凑数而随意购买球员。

sentences.english: Food manufacturers are required to list ingredients in order of quantity after all.
sentences.chinese: 食品生产商按要求列出成分表毕竟只为了凑数。

sentences.english: I'd rather have 24 players, but I don't want to take players on just to make up the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 我更倾向于拥有24名选手，但是我不会单纯的凑数。

definition: to make up the number (i.e. to fill places up to a given number)/to serve as stopgap
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
not presentable/shoddy and too embarrassing to show
to scrape together enough (people, money etc)
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
better than nothing (idiom)
to scare people/to bluff/to deceive
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
at most/at best
lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
